026package com.ibm.streams.flow.samples.javaprimitives;
027
028import java.util.Random;
029
030import com.ibm.streams.flow.declare.OperatorGraph;
031import com.ibm.streams.flow.declare.OperatorGraphFactory;
032import com.ibm.streams.flow.declare.OperatorInvocation;
033import com.ibm.streams.flow.declare.OutputPortDeclaration;
034import com.ibm.streams.flow.handlers.StreamCounter;
035import com.ibm.streams.flow.javaprimitives.JavaOperatorTester;
036import com.ibm.streams.flow.javaprimitives.JavaTestableGraph;
037import com.ibm.streams.operator.Operator;
038import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingData.Punctuation;
039import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.sources.RandomBeacon;
041
042/**
043 * Collection of sample tests for source operators using
044 * the {@link JavaOperatorTester test framework}.
045 * <BR>
046 * The methods demonstrate creation of a graph and testing
047 * of various aspects of that graph, include testing output.
048 * A specific test framework (such as JUnit or TestNG)
049 * is not used, with instead Java platform assertions
050 * used to verify state. Typically it is expected that
051 * testing of toolkits would use a testing framework. 
052 */
053public class SourceSamples {
054    
055    /**
056     * Create and execute a graph containing a single
057     * {@link RandomBeacon} operator. Verify it produces
058     * the correct number of tuples and punctuation marks.
059     * 
060     * @throws Exception Unexpected exception declaring or executing graph
061     * @see RandomBeacon
062     */
063    public void randomBeacon() throws Exception {
064        
065        final int iterations = 100;
066
067        final OperatorGraph graph = OperatorGraphFactory.newGraph();
068
069        // Declare a beacon operator
070        OperatorInvocation<RandomBeacon> beacon = graph
071                .addOperator(RandomBeacon.class);
072        beacon.setIntParameter("iterations", iterations)
073               .setDoubleParameter("period", 0.001);
074        
075        // With a single output port
076        OutputPortDeclaration beaconOutput = beacon
077                .addOutput("tuple<rstring name>");
078              
079        // Graph is now declared, create an executable version       
080        JavaOperatorTester jot = new JavaOperatorTester();       
081        JavaTestableGraph tg = jot.executable(graph);
082        
083        // Register a handler to count tuples and
084        // punctuation marks
085        StreamCounter<Tuple> counter = new StreamCounter<Tuple>();        
086        tg.registerStreamHandler(beaconOutput, counter);
087        
088        // Execute the graph. RandomBeacon submits
089        // a final marker after it has submitted the required
090        // number of tuples (defined by the iterations parameter)
091        // which will cause the graph to complete.
092        tg.executeToCompletion();
093        
094        // Verify the output.
095        assert counter.getTupleCount() == iterations;
096        assert counter.getMarkCount(Punctuation.WINDOW_MARKER) == 1;
097        assert counter.getMarkCount(Punctuation.FINAL_MARKER) == 1;
098    }
099    
100    /**
101     * Create a {@link RandomBeacon} and verify its parameters
102     * are set correctly. This demonstrates accessing the
103     * reference to instance of the {@link Operator} under test
104     * using {@link JavaTestableGraph#getOperatorInstance(OperatorInvocation)}.
105     */
106    public void randomBeaconParameters() throws Exception {
107        final OperatorGraph graph = OperatorGraphFactory.newGraph();
108
109        // Declare a beacon operator
110        OperatorInvocation<RandomBeacon> beacon = graph
111                .addOperator(RandomBeacon.class);
112        
113        // Add required output port
114        beacon.addOutput("tuple<rstring name>");
115        
116        Random rand = new Random();
117        final long seed = rand.nextLong();
118        final long delay = rand.nextInt(100)+ 1;
119        beacon.setLongParameter("seed", seed);
120        beacon.setLongParameter("initDelay", delay);
121              
122        // Graph is now declared, create an executable version       
123        JavaOperatorTester jot = new JavaOperatorTester();       
124        JavaTestableGraph tg = jot.executable(graph);
125        
126        // Initialize the operator to ensure that the setters
127        // have been called by the SPL runtime.
128        tg.initialize().get();
129        
130        // Get the instance of RandomBeacon executing in the graph
131        RandomBeacon runningBeacon = tg.getOperatorInstance(beacon);
132        
133        // Verify its setter methods were called.
134        assert seed == runningBeacon.getSeed();
135        assert delay == runningBeacon.getInitialDelay();
136
137        // Cleanup
138        tg.shutdown().get();
139    }
140}
